Submodules¶

optcom.utils.callable_container module¶

class optcom.utils.callable_container.CallableContainer(function, variables=[])¶

Bases: object

This class host a function which have argument that can be functions themselves (of the same arguments). The call to __call__ allows to pass this common arguments to the function arguments of the main function and pass the results to the main function.

Parameters

  • function -- The main callable which will be call in the __call__.

  • variables -- Variables of the function.

optcom.utils.callable_litt_expr module¶

class optcom.utils.callable_litt_expr.CallableLittExpr(fcts, operators=[])¶

Bases: object

This class allow to perform operations on functions of the same arguments.

Parameters

  • fcts -- A series of callables or constants which composed the litteral expression to evaluate.

  • operators -- A list of str which correspond to the operator to apply between two elements of the litteral expression. The length should be len(fcts) - 1.

Bases: Exception

optcom.utils.id_tracker module¶

class optcom.utils.id_tracker.IdTracker(nbr_eqs, prop_dir)¶

Bases: object

Save the position of each field and waves.

Parameters

  • nbr_eqs -- The number of equations.

  • prop_dir -- If [i] is True, waves in equation [i] are co-propagating relatively to equation [0]. If [i] is False, waves in equations [i] are counter-propagating relatively to equation [0]. prop_dir[0] must be True. len(prop_dir) must be equal to nbr_eqs.

are_field_ids_co_prop(id_1, id_2)¶

Return True if id_1 and id_2 are related to co-propagating equations.

are_wave_ids_co_prop(id_1, id_2)¶

Return True if id_1 and id_2 are related to co-propagating equations.

check_field_id(field_id)¶

Pre-process the field id.

check_wave_id(wave_id)¶

Pre-process the wave id.

eq_id_of_field_id(field_id)¶

Return the equation id to which field_id belongs.

eq_id_of_wave_id(wave_id)¶

Return the equation id to which wave_id belongs.

field_ids_in_eq_id(eq_id)¶

Return the start and end field_ids in the equation with id eq_id.

fields_in_eq_id(fields, eq_id)¶

Return all fields from fields in the equation with id eq_id.

fields_out_eq_id(fields, eq_id)¶

Return all fields from fields out of the equation with id eq_id.

initialize(fields_per_eq)¶

Get positions of the waves and fields according to their related equation. Each element of wave_ids contains the last index of the wave contained in the equation, which id is the index in eq_ids, considering that all waves of all fields form one array. Each element of field_ids contains the index of the last fields from equation which id is the index in eq_ids.

property nbr_fields¶

Return the total number of fields.

nbr_fields_in_eq(eq_id)¶

Return the number of fields in the equation with id eq_id.

property nbr_waves¶

Return the total number of waves.

nbr_waves_in_eq(eq_id)¶

Return the number of waves in the equation with id eq_id.

rel_wave_id(wave_id)¶

Return the wave id if there were only waves from the equation to which wave_id belongs to.

reset()¶
wave_ids_in_eq_id(eq_id)¶

Return the start and end wave_ids in the equation with id eq_id.

waves_in_eq_id(waves, eq_id)¶

Return all waves from waves in the equation with id eq_id.

waves_out_eq_id(waves, eq_id)¶

Return all waves from waves out of the equation with id eq_id.

Plot a 3D graph.

optcom.utils.plot.add_subplot_para(plt_to_add, x_label=None, y_label=None, z_label=None, x_range=None, y_range=None, z_range=None, plot_title=None)¶
optcom.utils.plot.animation2d(x_datas, y_datas, z_datas=None, x_label=None, y_label=None, x_range=None, y_range=None, line_styles=['-'], line_widths=[1.0], line_labels=None, line_colors=None, plot_title=None, opacity=0.2, fig_title=None, filename='', resolution=1920.0, 1080.0, interval=100.0, repeat=True, repeat_delay=1000.0)¶

Plot an 2D animation.

Parameters

  • x_datas -- The data on the x axis.

  • y_datas -- The data on the y axis.

  • z_datas -- The data on the z axis, will be display as text

  • x_label -- The labels for each axis along the x axis.

  • y_label -- The labels for each axis along the y axis.

  • x_range -- The ranges for each axis along the x axis.

  • y_range -- The ranges for each axis along the y axis.

  • line_styles -- The linestyle of the lines.

  • line_widths -- The linewidth of the lines.

  • line_labels -- The labels for each lines.

  • line_colors -- The color of each line.

  • plot_title -- The title of the animation.

  • opacity -- The opacity of the lines.

  • fig_title -- The figure title.

  • filename -- The filename where to save the animation. If provided, the animation will be saved.

  • resolution -- The resolution with which to save the animation.

  • interval -- The interval in between each frame.

  • repeat -- Either to repeat the animation when it is displayed.

  • repeat_delay -- The delay in between each repetition.

optcom.utils.plot.apply_protocol_decorator(func)¶
optcom.utils.plot.check_axis_labels(labels_to_check, labels)¶

Check if can assimilate given label to recorded ones.

optcom.utils.plot.get_graph_layout(plot_groups, split, length)¶
optcom.utils.plot.get_graph_structure(nbr_graphs)¶
optcom.utils.plot.plot2d(x_datas, y_datas, x_labels=None, y_labels=None, x_ranges=None, y_ranges=None, line_styles=['-'], line_widths=[1.0], line_labels=None, line_colors=None, plot_titles=None, plot_groups=None, split=False, opacity=[0.2], fig_title=None, filename='', resolution=1920.0, 1080.0, triangle_layout=False)¶

Plot an 2D graph.

Parameters

  • x_datas -- The data on the x axis.

  • y_datas -- The data on the y axis.

  • x_label -- The labels for each axis on each plot along the x axis.

  • y_label -- The labels for each axis on each plot along the y axis.

  • x_range -- The ranges for each axis on each plot along the x axis.

  • y_range -- The ranges for each axis on each plot along the y axis.

  • line_styles -- The linestyle of the lines.

  • line_widths -- The width of the lines.

  • line_labels -- The labels for each line on each plot.

  • line_colors -- The color of each line on each plot.

  • plot_titles -- The title of each plot.

  • plot_groups -- The group of each line. The line having the same number will be displayed on the plot.

  • split -- If True, split all the lines in one plote. If False, group all the lines in one plot. Only considered if plot_groups is None.

  • opacity -- The opacity of the lines.

  • fig_title -- The figure title.

  • filename -- The filename where to save the image. If provided, the animation will be saved.

  • resolution -- The resolution with which to save the image.

  • triangle_layout -- Option for 3 plots, if True, put the one wide plot at the bottom and the 2 other plots on the top.

optcom.utils.plot.plot3d(x_datas, y_datas, z_datas=None, x_labels=None, y_labels=None, z_labels=None, x_ranges=None, y_ranges=None, z_ranges=None, line_colors=None, plot_titles=None, plot_groups=None, split=False, opacity=[0.8], fig_title=None, filename='', resolution=1920.0, 1080.0, plot_types=['plot_surface'], triangle_layout=False)¶

Plot an 3D graph.

Parameters

  • x_datas -- The data on the x axis.

  • y_datas -- The data on the y axis.

  • z_datas -- The data on the z axis.

  • x_label -- The labels for each axis on each plot along the x axis.

  • y_label -- The labels for each axis on each plot along the y axis.

  • z_label -- The labels for each axis on each plot along the z axis.

  • x_range -- The ranges for each axis on each plot along the x axis.

  • y_range -- The ranges for each axis on each plot along the y axis.

  • z_range -- The ranges for each axis on each plot along the z axis.

  • line_colors -- The color of each line on each plot.

  • plot_titles -- The title of each plot.

  • plot_groups -- The group of each line. The line having the same number will be displayed on the plot.

  • split -- If True, split all the lines in one plote. If False, group all the lines in one plot. Only considered if plot_groups is None.

  • opacity -- The opacity of the lines.

  • fig_title -- The figure title.

  • filename -- The filename where to save the image. If provided, the animation will be saved.

  • resolution -- The resolution with which to save the image.

  • plot_types -- The type of each plot, see matplotlib documentation for more.

  • triangle_layout -- Option for 3 plots, if True, put the one wide plot at the bottom and the 2 other plots on the top.

optcom.utils.synchroniser module¶

exception optcom.utils.synchroniser.InitializationError¶

Bases: optcom.utils.synchroniser.SynchroniserError

class optcom.utils.synchroniser.Synchroniser(INTRA_COMP_DELAY, INTRA_PORT_DELAY, INTER_PORT_DELAY, REP_FREQ_DELAY=False)¶

Bases: object

Parameters

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

  • REP_FREQ_DELAY -- If True, take into account the pulses at regular interval specified by the repetition frequency.

initialize(init_delays, rep_freqs, id_tracker, dtime)¶
sync(waves, delays, id=0)¶

Adjust the wave envelopes in waves depending on their delays compare to the waves at the reference position id.

Parameters

  • waves -- The envelope value of each wave at each time step.

  • delays -- The current delays of each wave.

  • id -- The reference position of the wave from which to synchronise the other waves.

Returns

Array containing the waves synchronised with the wave at reference position id.

exception optcom.utils.synchroniser.SynchroniserError¶

Bases: Exception

optcom.utils.taylor module¶

class optcom.utils.taylor.Taylor¶

Bases: object

Represent a Taylor series.

static series(derivative, x_diff, start=0, stop=- 1, skip=[])¶

Calculate the Taylor series according to the given parameters.

Parameters

  • derivative -- The derivatives of the function to approximate.

  • x_diff -- The values of the variables.

Returns

Taylor series evaluation.

Notes

\[\begin{split}f(x) &= \sum_{n=0}^N \frac{f_n}{n!} (x - x_0)^n \quad \text{where} \quad f_n = \left. \frac{d^n f}{dx^n} \right\rvert_{x = x_0}\\\end{split}\]
